channel.title: miscellaneous on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in miscellaneous on Barefoot Rob

item.title: My new Crocs... when they were new.
item.description:
##16:11 Wednesday 31 October 2007
My new Crocs… when they were new. Originally uploaded by thunderrabbit I bought these shoes after I saw Jason with a pair before they were crazy popular.

item.title: poster girl
item.description:
##00:01 Tuesday 02 October 2007
I felt a little bit guilty, but I stole this poster from the train. The girl is just too cute to pass up. I learned my lesson by not taking the Gemma Ward ad until too late. Blogged with Flock Tags: poster, theft, cute

item.title: Not sure what's in this backpack
item.description: ##17:56 Monday 01 October 2007 I saw a guy wearing this backpack in Shibuya station today. It was shaped kinda like a short pyramid with the top removed. What is inside?? Blogged with Flock Tags: photos, backpack, Shibuya, strange

item.title: My Love-Hate Relationship With English, by Akiko Shimada
item.description: ##14:04 Sunday 15 July 2007 Looking back over the years, I’m surprised by how much time and how much money I’ve devoted to English, the world’s most dominant language. Sometimes I love English, but sometimes I really hate it, feeling that my longtime efforts haven’t been paying off. I still have difficulty dealing with the language. To begin with, English is illogical and capricious. I don’t think I’ll be able to understand it completely even if I keep studying it for the rest of my life.

item.title: Ice Cream!!!!!!
item.description: ##02:41 Tuesday 11 July 2006 Although ice cream can be easy to make at home, it is actually a very complex substance. In this article, we’ll learn how it’s made, what goes into it, and who invented it. Howstuffworks “How Ice Cream Works” Wow! I never knew the complexities of ice cream! Blogged with Flock

item.title: Wasps: nature's flying noses
item.description: ##00:44 Saturday 26 November 2005 Unlike dogs and electronic sensors currently in use, the wasps are disposable. They cost pennies and take minutes to train. Wired News: Sting Operation Targets Terror Woah. This counts for one of them ideas that anyone coulda thunk of. I think.

item.title: longbets.org
item.description: ##06:55 Thursday 20 October 2005 longbets.org These are my favorite predictions, sometimes cause I don’t really understand them. https://www.longbets.org/69 AI viruses https://www.longbets.org/86 robot attack classes https://www.longbets.org/92 propellant? we don’t need no stinking propellant! https://www.longbets.org/143 could you fax me my wallet? https://www.longbets.org/148 is google surpassable? https://www.longbets.org/175 I’m so thirsty! https://www.longbets.org/176 anyone agree? Bueller? Here is the first bet placed on the site; the betters paid $10,000 each! https://www.longbets.org/1 computer textually emulate a human by 2029

item.title: long jokes
item.description: ##02:52 Sunday 16 October 2005 These are the long jokes I know. They are more like stories with silly punchlines. I wrote the one about the kid who loves to do dishes. How to catch a pink elephant Moe and Joe Kid who loved green golf balls Kid who loved clowns Magician and the captain’s parrot Kid who loved to do dishes Ten little piggies
